formattedAddress: 64th Street and, 5th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 64th Street and, 5th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Central Park eatery open during zoo hours with indoor & outdoor seating, plus light cafe fare.

originalText.text:
Confession: I am local and I eat here twice a month with my dog.
Sometimes you just want to sit at the zoo with your dog to share chicken fingers and French fries. Dancing Crane Café is the place for that!

I don't understand the bad reviews. What else did they expect from a zoo concession stand? The food is salty and delicious. The soda and beer are cold. The cashier line is fast. The seating area is clean. That's literally an A+ everything for a concession stand. They even have a bathroom inside, despite the signs that say otherwise.

It's just outside the fence of the Central Park Zoo, but I like to tell people I'm at the zoo having lunch with my dog. :)

originalText.text:
Everything is over priced and I just paid $1.62 for a single banana JUST to use the restroom. The staff is nice and understanding and the place is generally clean.

Nobody should have to pay this much to eat at a ZOO.

text.text:

originalText.text: Overpriced, substandard food and unprofessional staff. One half serves the food, but the microfranchised coffee kiosk next door serves coffee, tea and hot chocolate (would it really have been so hard to provide these on the same ridiculously long lines on which droves of customers stand for their "food"?!). Cleaning done by shutting down sections at a time of the seating area, which concentrates strangers into the remaining seats. The one redeeming feature (weather permitting) is the al fresco dining section.

originalText.text: I used this place as the meeting point for my son as he went off on his own to visit the zoo here. I sat outside and supped a Cafe Latte whilst working out what to do for the rest of the morning. Using the cafe's free WiFi was helpful in that respect. I then left for a stroll through Central Park before returing a couple of hours later. By then I needed the restrooms so joined the short, orderly queue. They say that the restrooms are only for customers only but, of course, I had been one a few hours earlier. As it was no one arrested me and I felt more comfortable to continue our walking tour of the Big Apple. Neither my son nor I felt that this looked a particularly appealing place to have lunch and, anyway, their prices were "impressive"...

originalText.text: The worst. I needed the restroom and there is an advise in the restroom’s door that says that you can open the Bathroom only with a code in the receipt. Therefore you are unable to use the bathroom without buying. The worst part is that it is the only bathroom in the zoo area.
